headline: Thermo Fisher Scientific Increases Quarterly Dividend
summary: WALTHAM, Mass., February 25, 2026--Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. (NYSE: TMO), the world leader in serving science, today announced that its Board of Directors authorized a quarterly cash dividend of $0.47 per common share, payable on April 15, 2026, to shareholders of record as of March 13, 2026. This reflects a 10% increase over the previous dividend payment of $0.43.

headline: How Is Thermo Fisher Scientific’s Stock Performance Compared to Other Medical Devices Stocks?
summary: Although Thermo Fisher Scientific stock has declined over the past year, it has slightly outperformed other medical device stocks, and analysts remain highly bullish about its prospects.

headline: Thermo Fisher Datavant Deal Deepens Real World Data Role In Trials
summary: Thermo Fisher Scientific (NYSE:TMO) announced a new data collaboration with Datavant focused on integrating real world data into clinical research. The partnership is aimed at more secure data connectivity and advanced analytics for pharmaceutical and biotech studies. The initiative builds on Thermo Fisher's existing AI and digital investments to support evidence generation across life sciences. For investors watching NYSE:TMO, this move sits at the intersection of laboratory tools, data...

headline: Preimplantation Genetic Testing Market Research and Global Forecast Report 2025-2030
summary: The preimplantation genetic testing market is projected to surge from USD 690.2 million in 2025 to USD 1.13 billion by 2030, reflecting a robust CAGR of 10.5%. Key growth drivers include rising genetic disorder prevalence, increased awareness of early genetic diagnosis, and the widespread adoption of in-vitro fertilization (IVF) procedures. Technological advancements in next-generation sequencing (NGS) and polymerase chain reaction (PCR) also propel the market. However, high costs and ethical ch
